CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Failed Brute Force Auth
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple failed authentication attempts from the same external origin host to the same impacted host, without seeing an authentication success.
User Analytics - UTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Failed Account Probe
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple external unique login attempts are made unsuccessfully on the same host within a short period of time.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Port Scan then Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Port scan on multiple unique impacted ports is followed by an attack/malware/compromise/critical/DoS event within an hour on one of the impacted hosts. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 9.6, CSC 12.4

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Multiple Unique Attacks Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple unique external attack events against the same host. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 8.1, CSC 12.4

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Recon Followed by Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: External reconnaissance event followed by an attack on the same host.
Modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement With Acct Sweep
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: The same internal account is used to attempt to authenticate to multiple hosts within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Distributed Auth Fail
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple failed authentication attempts from different internal origin hosts to the same impacted host using the same origin login, without seeing an authentication success.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Internal Port Scan then Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Port scan on multiple, unique ports followed by an attack/malware/compromise/critical/DoS event within a given time period on one of the impacted hosts (default 1 hour).
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Multiple Unique Attack Events
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Multiple, unique attack events against the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Internal Recon then Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Reconnaissance event against a host followed by an attack.
Modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Attack then Critical Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attack event against a host followed by an error on the same host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Recon after Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A security related event followed by a port scan from the same source. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.4

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: SQL Injection
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Common URL-encoded SQL Injection string in a URL.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Common URL-encoded <script> tags in a URL, indicating a reflected cross-site scripting attack.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Vuln Exploited Internally
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack events on a specific host that use a known vulnerability vector that was found on a specific host during a vuln scan.
Modules: APT

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Vuln Exploited Externally
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Security related events on a specific host and port, preceeded by a vulnerability event on the same host and port.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: WADM: Internal Malicious User-Agent
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: User agent strings used by hacking/security research tools found in web server logs.
Modules: WADM

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: WADM: External Malicious User-Agent
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: User agent string used by hacking/security research tools found in web server logs.
Modules: WADM SANS Top 20

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Suspicious URL Characters from Int
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Malicious characters in the URL string found in web server log from an internal source.
Modules: WADM

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: WADM: External Suspicious URL Characters
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Malicious characters in the URL string found in web server log.
Modules: WADM SANS Top 20

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Attack Alert Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any identified attack event in supplemental support of PCI-DSS Controls: 6.5.8, 6.6, 11.4.a-c, 12.10.5

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP : Attack Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on attack activity within the organization infrastructure.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Abnormal Origin Location
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: First tracks geographic locations for VPN logins. Afterwards, triggers when a new origin location is seen for a user.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53 : Attack Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on attacks.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Ext Mltpl Uniq Attacks Same Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple unique external attack events on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NIST 800-53: Int Mltpl UniqAttacks Same Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple unique internal attack events on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13 : Attack Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule directly supports GPG-13 controls PMC3.4, PMC5.2, PMC5.4, PMC5.7, PMC5.8, and PMC6.12 by alerting on all attacks.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Attack then Inbound Traffic
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Attacks from an external source followed by traffic to or from that source. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.3

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Internal ICMP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A single internal host is sending a single flow with over 60,000 packets to another internal host using the ICMP protocol.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Internal TCP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A single internal host is sending a single flow with over 100,000 packets to another internal host using the TCP protocol.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Internal UDP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A single internal host is sending a single flow with over 100,000 packets to another internal host using the UDP protocol.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Internal Unknown Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: A single internal host is sending a single flow with over 60,000 packets to another internal host using an Unknown protocol.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Inbound SSH on Non-standard Port
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Detects inbound SSH traffic connecting over a non-standard port (not 22). CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Repeat Security Events
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: The same security related event occurs on a single host 10 or more times.
ETD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Blocked Outbound Traffic then Allow
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: 400 or more internal network traffic denies, followed by a network allow event with the same origin host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: WADM: Internal Bad Bot User-Agent
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Monitors web server logs for the presence of user agent strings used by Bad Bots -- scanners that have exhibited malicious behaviors such as email harvesting or acting as a spam referal bot.
Modules: WADM

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Repeat Attacks Against a Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: The same security event is detected on the same host multiple times within a short window. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Blacklisted User-Agent String
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Blacklisted devices attempting to communicate on the network. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 12.1, CSC 18.2

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSC: Blacklisted Ingress Port Observed
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Triggered when an external host communicates with a network host on a port not on the allowed ingress list. CIS Critical Security Control(s): CSC 9.2, CSC 12.1

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Drupal Account Exfiltration
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This rule fires when an attacker attempts to exfiltrate sensitive information from the application using the Devel module.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Suspicious Top Level Domain (TLD)
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: HTTP traffic to TLDs that wouldn't be expected in most cases.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Attack IP
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : IP : Attack"

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Bot IP
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : IP : Bot"
Modules:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Fraud IP
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : IP : Fraud"
Modules:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Attack URL
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : URL : Attack"
Modules:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Bot URL
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : URL : Bot"
Modules:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Network Anomaly: Threat List Fraud URL
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Communication with an IP listed in the list "LR Threat List : URL : Fraud"
Modules:

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Attack Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on attacks.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Ext Mltpl Uniq Attacks Same Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple unique external attack events on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CSF: Int Mltpl UniqAttacks Same Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule provides details on multiple unique internal attack events on the same impacted host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Int Use of Bash Vulnerability Exploit
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Monitors web server logs for the presence of malicious requests like the ones in CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-7169 and CVE-2014-7186.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Bash Vulnerability Exploit
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Monitors web server logs for the presence of malicious requests like the ones in CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-7169 and CVE-2014-7186.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13: Attack Detected at Boundary
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected attacks (success/failure) against all boundary monitoring devices to supplement testing of GPG-13 control PMC3.4 [Alert B]

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13: Suspected Internal Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected attacks (success/failure) against the internal boundary monitoring devices to supplement testing of GPG-13 control PMC5.7 [Alert C]

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: GPG-13: Suspected Wireless Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected wireless attacks (success/failure) against the boundary monitoring devices to supplement testing of GPG-13 control PMC6.12 [Alert D]

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Account Anomaly: Domain Privilege Escalation
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: To detect CVE-2014-6324, Windows Domain privilege escalation vulnerability. Patched in MS14-068.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Port Scan then Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Port scan on multiple unique impacted ports is followed by an attack/malware/compromise/critical/DoS event within an hour on one of the impacted hosts.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Multiple Unique Attacks
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Multiple unique external attack events against the same host.
Holistic Analytics - HTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Attack then Outbound Connection
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: An observed external attack or compromise followed by data leaving the system and going to the attacker.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Lateral: Internal Recon After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: A security related event followed by a port sweep from the same source.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: SQL Injection
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Common URL-encoded SQL Injection string in a URL.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Cross-site Scripting
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Common URL-encoded <script> tags in a URL, indicating a reflected cross-site scripting attack.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Dot Dot Slash Directory Traversal
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Use of special characters related to directory traversal observed in a URL.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Malicious User-Agent
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: User agent string used by hacking/security research tools found in web server logs.
Modules: WADM SANS Top 20

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attack: Suspicious URL Characters
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Malicious characters in the URL string found in web server log.
Modules: WADM SANS Top 20

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Abnormal File Access
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: First tracks which files users generally accesses over a learning period. Afterward, triggers if a user begins accessing different files.
UTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: ICMP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Single external host sending a single flow with over 60,000 ICMP packets to an internal host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: TCP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Single external host sending a single flow with over 100,000 TCP packets to an internal host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: UDP Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Single external host sending a single flow with over 100,000 UDP packets to an internal host.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: DoS: Unknown Flood
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Single external host sending a single flow with over 60,000 packets to an internal host using an Unknown protocol.
Network Analytics - NTA

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Config Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: Attack event on a host followed by a configuration change made to that host within 3 minutes.
ETD CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Repeated Attacks Against Host
CommonEvent.ShortDesc:
AIE: The same security event is detected on the same host multiple times within a short window.
CTD

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Config Change After Attack
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on attack event on a host followed by a configuration change made to that host within 3 minutes.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: ISO-27001: Attack Detected Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected attacks (success/failure) against all boundary monitoring devices

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: NERC-CIP: Attack Detected Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts on known attacks or failed attack attempts across the environment.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: BSI:IT-G: Syst. Ausprobieren von Passwörtern
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: BSI:IT-Grundschutz: G5.18 Systematisches Ausprobieren von Passwörtern

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: BSI:IT-G: Cross Site Scripting (XSS)
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: BSI:IT-Grundschutz: G5.170 Cross Site Scripting (XSS)

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: SOX: Attack Detected Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts on known attacks or failed attack attempts across the environment.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: HSS: Attack Detected Rule
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts on known attacks or failed attack attempts across the environment.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Initial Compromise
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning is followed by Initial Compromise with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Command and Control
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning or Initial Compromise is followed by Command and Control with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Lateral Movement
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as an earlier stage is followed by Lateral Movement with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Initial Compromise
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning is followed by Initial Compromise with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Command and Control
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning or Initial Compromise is followed by Command and Control with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Lateral Movement
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as an earlier stage is followed by Lateral Movement with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Initial Compromise
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning is followed by Initial Compromise with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Command and Control
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning or Initial Compromise is followed by Command and Control with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Lateral Movement
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as an earlier stage is followed by Lateral Movement with the same user or host.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: MAS: Attack Detected Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE rule creates an event and alerts on known attacks or failed attack attempts across the environment.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: MAS: Suspected Wireless Attack Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected wireless attacks (success/failure) against the boundary monitoring devices.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: PCI-DSS: Attack Alert
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule alerts on the occurrence of any identified attack event.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: SQL Injection Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Alarm generated from an IDS/IPS event identifying a SQL Injection attempt.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Event
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Alarm generated from an IDS/IPS or WAF event identifying a Cross-Site scripting attempt.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Abnormal Origin Location
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: First tracks geographic locations for VPN logins. Afterwards, triggers when a new origin location is seen for a user.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: CCF: Suspected Wireless Attack Alarm
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: This AIE Rule creates an event and alerts on suspected wireless attacks (success/failure) against the boundary monitoring devices.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Attainment: Abnormal File Access
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: First tracks which files users generally accesses over a learning period. Afterward, triggers if a user begins accessing different files.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: C2: Abnormal Origin Location
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: First tracks geographic locations for VPN logins. Afterwards, triggers when a new origin location is seen for a user.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Compromise: Lateral Movement With Account Swe
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: The same internal account is used to attempt to authenticate to multiple hosts within a short period of time, followed by a successful authentication.

CommonEvent.Name: AIE: Progression: to Initial Compromise
CommonEvent.ShortDesc: AIE: Progression rules monitor for activity moving through the attack lifecycle. This alarm will fire when observed activity categorized as Reconnaissance and Planning is followed by Initial Compromise with the same user or host.
